item.title: Unswept area and littering, 21st November
item.description:
The whole stretch of northwold road (north side) from number 71 to the church has not been swept in weeks. Litter has built up at the bus stop.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Northwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Significant damage to paths either side of norman road, 21st November
item.description:
This road is currently unwalkable due to the severe damage and unstable concrete along the footpaths. There are broken and uneven sections of concrete across the entire stretch, leaving no safe place to walk, particularly when the ground is wet and becomes extremely slippery. It poses a clear safety risk to pedestrians and needs urgent repair.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Norman Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car parked on pavement, 21st November
item.description:
There is a car parked on pavement restricted access of my wheelchair. I had to cross road, please try and sort the issue. One resident said it's been like that for a few days. It's not great for the elderly either or people who are blind.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Shawbury Road, East Dulwich, Greater London

item.title: Whole of Kelly Street, 21st November
item.description:
Tree Works signs have appeared in the street scheduled for 3 December (Parking Suspension Ref 190908886). The trees were last pollarded in December 2023. Several of the white beams have barely grown new branches (see photos attached), and many of the trees are in no way ready to be pollarded again. The residents of Kelly Street do not want the trees pollarded, and ask you to intervene as soon as possible to cancel these works. Apart from being unnecessary, pollarding destroys the picturesque nature of the street, and destroys the beauty that so many residents and visitors admire. Its also an expensive process which nobody here wants and it’s a waste of Council time and money,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Kelly Street, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
